documents.title: Cloudora Employee Master Overview
documents.content: This KB contains the complete 7-day trial onboarding, immediate demo material, task activation rules, role definitions, payout & incentive rules, and assessment MCQs. Genie will use this module to coach employees, grade assessments, assign tasks, and calculate payouts.

documents.title: 7-Day Trial Plan — Summary
documents.content: New joiners receive an immediate 1–3 hour demo (Day 1) covering Cloudora intro, services, telecalling basics, CRM rules, scripts, and task-start training. Days 2–7 include daily lessons, practice tasks, and an assessment on Day 7. After Day 1 the system automatically flips the user into task-mode (if Day1 lessons are delivered).

documents.title: 7-Day Trial — Daily Breakdown
documents.content: Day1 (Immediate demo: 1–3 hours): Cloudora intro, services, telecalling basics, CRM rules, scripts, start/stop demo. Day2: Telecalling practice + CRM updates. Day3: Qualification & objection handling + practice. Day4: Product & pricing basics + call script practice. Day5: Follow-ups & reporting; Day6: Quality checks & roleplay; Day7: Final assessment (MCQ + roleplay) + selection decision.

documents.title: First Login: Immediate Demo Flow (1–3 hours)
documents.content: On first login: deliver the Day1 lesson pack (videos/text/scripts/quick quizzes). After the pack is delivered, enable task mode. Employee sees: 'Start Tasks' button, daily task list, start/stop timer. Genie will ask: choose shift, preferred country, preferred product. If employee completes Day1 demo, assign starting call tasks automatically.

documents.title: Task Activation & Lifecycle Rules
documents.content: Tasks are created from CSV leads or system queues. Telecaller tasks: task_type='call'. Task lifecycle: assigned → in_progress → completed | failed. Employee may claim/unclaim tasks. Start task toggles started_at; stop toggles completed_at. Employee must update CRM after each call. Tasks inherit product and country; shift selection is stored in employee prefs. Unhandled or unassigned tasks appear in admin unassigned queue.

documents.title: CSV Lead Upload & Distribution
documents.content: Admin uploads CSV → system inserts to leads table → round-robin assigns to available telecallers (role='telecaller', status active/available). For each insert a task is created in employee_tasks. If no telecaller available, tasks are marked unassigned for manager claiming.

documents.title: CRM Update Requirements
documents.content: After each call the telecaller must add: call_status (connected/not_connected/followup/qualified/disqualified), detailed notes, next_followup_date if needed. For a lead to be 'qualified' the CRM record must include requirement + budget (approx) + timeline + reachable contact number. Genie validates missing CRM fields and prompts the telecaller to complete them.

documents.title: Role Definitions & Access
documents.content: Telecaller: call + qualify + CRM updates + earn per-lead incentives. Sales: handle qualified leads, proposal, close deals, earns closing commission. Manager: assign tasks, review, claim admin rights. Freelancer/Part-time: performance-only (₹50/lead + 3% conversion for 1st month; continues while active). Full-time selected employees: fixed salary + 1% conversion incentive for 1st month; ₹50/lead stops for fixed staff.

documents.title: Payouts: Trial & Post-Trial Rules (Summary)
documents.content: Trial/Part-time: ₹50 per qualified lead + 3% commission on sale conversion for first month. Full-time selected employees: fixed salary + 1% commission for the first month only; the ₹50 per-lead stops. Sales closers: 10% on sale. Renewal (next month same customer): Sales gets 5%; lead generator gets 1% if still active. Freelancers keep ₹50 per lead + 3% conversion during their active period.

documents.title: Payout Examples (Clear)
documents.content: Example: Telecaller generates a lead that sells for ₹100,000 in month1. If telecaller is trial/part-time: they get ₹50 + 3% of ₹100,000 = ₹3,000. If telecaller is full-time selected: they get 1% of ₹100,000 = ₹1,000 (no ₹50). Sales closer gets 10% = ₹10,000. On renewal next month (same client): sales gets 5% and telecaller (if still active) gets 1% of renewal value.

documents.title: Payout Timing & Tracking
documents.content: Trial incentive payouts are calculated daily/hourly logs but paid according to company payroll schedule (weekly or monthly as configured). All payout events logged in employee_payouts table with source (lead_id, sale_id), amount, and status (pending/paid). Genie can generate payout previews for admins.

documents.title: Selection After 7 Days
documents.content: After Day7 assessment Genie flags candidate as 'selected' or 'not_selected' based on assessment score, task completion, CRM discipline, and call quality. Selected employees move to 'full-time' onboarding, receive fixed salary offer, and rules change per payout policy. Non-selected employees may be rehired as freelancers or end trial.

documents.title: Employee UI — Task Controls
documents.content: UI buttons: Claim, Start (starts timer), Stop (stops timer), Complete (marks task completed with notes), Skip/Unassign. Genie will show tips and validate CRM fields before allowing Complete.

documents.title: XP & Leveling (Brief)
documents.content: Employees earn XP for training completion, CRM discipline, calls made, tasks completed, positive feedback. XP determines levels and privileges (task priority, shift selection). Genie tracks XP in employee_xp_log and updates leaderboard.

documents.title: Call Quality Checks & Feedback
documents.content: Genie randomly samples calls for QA, evaluates against checklist (greeting, discovery, tone, accuracy, CRM update). Genie provides 3 improvement suggestions per sampled call and stores results in employee_performance_log.

documents.title: Edge Cases & Special Rules
documents.content: If lead is duplicated or already existed, incentive is void. If a sale is reversed/refunded within return window, related commissions are deducted from next payout. For ambiguous qualification, manager review required before paying incentives.

documents.title: MCQ & Assessment Rules
documents.content: Assessments include MCQs and roleplay. MCQs are auto-scored. Roleplay is evaluated by Genie for structure, tone, and correctness — Genie returns a score and 3 improvement tips. Day7 final grade combines MCQ + roleplay + task completion and CRM discipline to decide selection.

documents.title: MCQ T1
documents.content: Q1: Telecaller ka first step kya hota hai? A) Price batana B) Greeting + verification C) Discount dena D) Call cut kar dena | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ T2
documents.content: Q2: Lead qualified tab hota hai jab: A) Sirf number active ho B) Customer ko requirement ho C) Budget + timeline dono mile D) Customer bole 'baad me call' | correct: C

documents.title: MCQ T3
documents.content: Q3: CRM me sabse important field kaun si hai? A) Customer ka naam B) Lead status C) Employee ID D) Date | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ T4
documents.content: Q4: Call notes me kya include karna chahiye? A) Requirement & budget B) Irrelevant personal details C) Just a tick D) N/A | correct: A

documents.title: MCQ T5
documents.content: Q5: Agar customer bole 'call me later', next step? A) Hangup B) Ask for best time + set follow-up C) Offer discount D) Ignore | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ T6
documents.content: Q6: Objection: 'Price high' — best reply? A) Lower price immediately B) Explain value + deliverables C) Argue D) End call | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ T7
documents.content: Q7: Telecaller follow-up frequency recommended? A) Never B) Daily until connected (respectfully) C) Only after 1 month D) Yearly | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ T8
documents.content: Q8: Required CRM fields to mark qualified? A) Name only B) Budget, timeline, requirement, valid phone C) Email only D) Nothing | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ T9
documents.content: Q9: If lead says 'we're small' — telecaller should: A) Drop call B) Ask about scope & adapt solution C) Mock them D) Transfer to manager | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ T10
documents.content: Q10: When to schedule follow-up? A) If customer requests a time B) Randomly C) Never D) After a year | correct: A

documents.title: MCQ S1
documents.content: Q1: Sales ka first step kya hota hai? A) Closing B) Pitching C) Requirement discovery D) Discount discussion | correct: C

documents.title: MCQ S2
documents.content: Q2: Sales commission rate (closing) as per policy? A) 3% B) 10% C) 5% D) 1% | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ S3
documents.content: Q3: After closing, who gets immediate commission? A) Telecaller B) Sales C) Manager D) None | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ S4
documents.content: Q4: For renewals next month, sales gets: A) 0% B) 5% C) 3% D) 10% | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ S5
documents.content: Q5: If telecaller created lead and sale closed, telecaller gets (trial): A) ₹50 B) 3% C) Both ₹50 + 3% D) None | correct: C

documents.title: MCQ S6
documents.content: Q6: Sales should record which field after closing? A) Price & terms B) Nothing C) Only email D) Only phone | correct: A

documents.title: MCQ S7
documents.content: Q7: For first month conversion commission for a selected full-time telecaller is: A) 1% B) 3% C) 10% D) 0% | correct: A

documents.title: MCQ S8
documents.content: Q8: Sales must always: A) Hide pricing B) Explain deliverables & timeline C) Promise unrealistic timelines D) Ignore objections | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ S9
documents.content: Q9: Who handles negotiation within guardrails? A) Telecaller B) Sales C) Freelancer D) Customer | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ S10
documents.content: Q10: When should sales transfer lead to manager? A) For contract > threshold B) For small leads C) Never D) Randomly | correct: A

documents.title: MCQ P1
documents.content: Q1: Trial telecaller per qualified lead amount? A) ₹20 B) ₹50 C) ₹100 D) 0 | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ P2
documents.content: Q2: Trial telecaller conversion commission? A) 1% B) 2% C) 3% D) 10% | correct: C

documents.title: MCQ P3
documents.content: Q3: Full-time selected employee conversion commission first month? A) 3% B) 1% C) 0% D) 10% | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ P4
documents.content: Q4: Sales closing commission? A) 5% B) 10% C) 3% D) 1% | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ P5
documents.content: Q5: Freelancer continues to earn per-lead fee until: A) they resign B) they remain active C) Only first week D) Never | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ C1
documents.content: Q1: Required CRM update after call includes: A) Call notes & next action B) Nothing C) Only time D) Only employee name | correct: A

documents.title: MCQ C2
documents.content: Q2: If CRM missing budget, Genie will: A) mark qualified anyway B) prompt user to collect budget C) delete lead D) escalate to sales | correct: B

documents.title: MCQ C3
documents.content: Q3: Disqualified leads are moved to: A) leads_disqualified B) sales_leads C) employee_tasks D) None | correct: A

documents.title: MCQ C4

documents.title: MCQ C5

documents.title: Deployment & Ingest Instructions (Short)
documents.content: Save this file as /backend/kb/kb_employees.json and run node ingest_master.js. Ensure employee tables and employee_tasks, employee_training_progress, employee_xp_log, employee_call_logs exist. After ingest, test: first-login demo flow for a sample user, CSV upload -> tasks created, start/stop task, complete call -> CRM validated, payout preview by admin.
